intro: Cymboglossum palawanense, commonly known as the Palawan cymboglossum, is a rare flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its bell-shaped, violet-blue flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone habitats, showcasing its adaptability to challenging environments. Its leaves are narrow and lanceolate, often with a bluish-green hue. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
